title: 2023 World AeroPress Champion - Tay Wipvasutt (Thailand) - Inverted
preparation_steps: Rinse and place a paper filter in the cap, if you prefer; assemble AeroPress inverted.
Weigh 18 g total: prepare 16 g to add initially and keep 2 g set aside for later addition.
Grind to the competition setting (1ZPresso ZP6, 65 clicks).
Heat Perfect Coffee Water to 89 °C. Prepare scale and timer.

brewing_steps.instruction: Place 16 g of grounds in the inverted AeroPress. Start timer and pour 100 g of 89 °C water over the grounds. Then stir for ~5 s to agitate and homogenize the slurry.
brewing_steps.audio_script: You have 45 seconds to pour 100 grams of 89 degrees water and stir for 5 seconds.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 0:45, add the remaining 2 g of coffee (late addition).
brewing_steps.audio_script: Add the remaining 2 grams of coffee for the late addition.

brewing_steps.instruction: At 0:55, stir again for ~5 s to incorporate the late addition.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Stir for 5 seconds to incorporate the late addition.

brewing_steps.instruction: Slightly press the plunger up to remove excess air, then securely close the cap.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Press out excess air and close the cap securely. Wait until 1 minute 40.

brewing_steps.instruction: Carefully flip the AeroPress and begin pressing at 1:40 (≈100 s). Press steadily for ~30 s. Target yield: ~75 g concentrate.
brewing_steps.audio_script: Flip the AeroPress and press steadily for 30 seconds. Target 75 grams of concentrate.

brewing_steps.instruction: Bypass the concentrate with room-temperature water until total weight reaches 115 g (first bypass).
brewing_steps.audio_script: Add room-temperature water until total weight reaches 115 grams.

brewing_steps.instruction: Then add hot water until total weight reaches 155 g (second bypass / final tempered).
brewing_steps.audio_script: Add hot water until total weight reaches 155 grams.

what_to_expect.description: The 2023 World AeroPress Champion recipe by Tay Wipvasutt uses an inverted method with a late coffee addition to refresh aromatics and enhance complexity without over-extraction. The press yields a concentrated base that is carefully diluted in two stages—first with room-temperature water for clarity and temperature control, then with hot water for strength. Expect a clean, fragrant cup with layered sweetness, lively acidity, and a silky texture. The technique highlights aroma retention, balance, and precision suitable for competition and everyday brewing.
what_to_expect.audio_script: This 2023 champion recipe uses an inverted method with a late coffee addition to refresh aromatics. Press a small, sweet concentrate and dilute in two stages—first room-temperature water for clarity and control, then hot water for strength. Expect a clean, layered cup with lively acidity and a silky texture.

notes: Technique by Tay Wipvasutt (World Champ 2023). Use of 'late addition' (2g added at 0:45) to introduce fresh aromatic compounds without over-extracting the main body. Bypass in two stages (room-temp and hot) to control strength and final temperature.
